content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and straightforward clash :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Noice

I think you should change "You are given a sequence of integers of size n."
to
"You are given [[n]] integers."

This is because "size n" is kind of confusing, like if it is asking the number of digit places.
Also, "sequence" means "a particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other." But these numbers don't really follow a pattern.

Otherwise, it looks good.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: This made me think

Goal / Output
* The statement has an issue because it directly specifies the exact condition the player needs to implement: arr[i] == arr[n-1-i]. This essentially gives away the solution, leaving much less room for problem-solving or exploration. Please rewrite the statement without explicitly spelling out the code.

* Please format "-1" as a {{constant}}.

All sections
* `arr` is not defined anywhere.

Constraints
* n never exceeds 10. arr[i] is never zero or negative, and it never exceeds 100. Please adjust the limits accordingly.

Cases
* Each test should be similar to its corresponding validator, featuring the same scenario with small differences in the inputs and outputs. Please rewrite the cases accordingly.

* Too many cases expect the output of 0. Please reduce the proportion of such cases, and there should be other expected outputs.

Thanks.

Goal
* Please format "n" and both instances of "i" as [[variables]].

Output
* Please format "i" as a [[variable]].

* Please change "exist" to "exists".

Constraints
* Please format "n" as a [[variable]].

* Please add "in the array" after "each element".

Cases
* Please add the following scenarios (each scenario = one test and one validator), using numbers > 9 as the array elements:

  â€¢ Single-element array
  
  â€¢ Odd-length array where only the middle element is self-matching (e.g. 14 31 57 73 85 62 46 99 28 -> answer is 4)
  
  â€¢ Even-length array where the first valid match is not at index 0 or 1
  
  â€¢ No matches but with repeated elements at non-mirror positions (e.g. 37 13 65 92 37 13 65 92 -> answer is -1)

Thanks.

Thanks. Glad you liked it...
Happy Codin..
Thank you! Glad you found it simple and easy.

Hi, thanks for the feedback! 

Iâ€™ve updated the contribution:
Rewrote the statement to avoid giving away the solution.
- Formatted [[n]], [[i]], and {{-1}}.
- Adjusted constraints and added â€œin the array.â€
- Added all requested test scenarios with numbers > 9.

All outputs have been verified. Could you please review it again?

Thank you. Much better now, just a few more things to adjust:

Goal
* Please format "-1" as a {{constant}}.

Constraints
* Please change 10 to 20 (because of the new Validator 6).

Cases
* Test 7: Please revise the case so that the answer is 2.

* Validator 7: Please revise the case so that n is an even number greater than 8 and the answer is greater than 2.

Thanks.

Please also add one more pair of cases:

â€¢ n is even, no matches but with repeated elements at non-mirror positions (e.g. 37 13 65 92 37 13 65 92 -> answer is -1)

Thanks.

Hi, thank you for the feedback!

Iâ€™ve updated the contribution:
- Formatted {{-1}} in the Goal section.
- Adjusted the constraints to 1 â‰¤ [[n]] â‰¤ 20.
- Test 7 now has the answer 2.
- Validator 7 now has an even n > 8 with answer > 2.
- Added a new pair of cases for even n with repeated elements at non-mirror positions, producing {{-1}}.

All outputs have been verified. Could you please review it again?

Validator 9
* Please change n to 10 and the array to 5 pairs of integers randomly mixed, while keeping the answer to -1.

Thanks.

Hi, thanks for the feedback!
Iâ€™ve updated Validator 9 as requested.

Thanks a lot for helping me reshape this question and making it proper.
